text: What I really missed in the virtual format was any kind of real audience. I thought people would give sort of like zoom talks and you could ask questions after, but instead it was like a chain of YouTube videos being made available and the discord threads seemed messy and couldn't keep up with the pace. I hope that this can be different next time around, but I guess there were good reasons for choosing that format

elements.text: What I really missed in the virtual format was any kind of real audience. I thought people would give sort of like zoom talks and you could ask questions after, but instead it was like a chain of YouTube videos being made available and the discord threads seemed messy and couldn't keep up with the pace. I hope that this can be different next time around, but I guess there were good reasons for choosing that format

text: The thing is, we have about 120 talks, and the amount of technical difficulties with video conferencing software you expect at that scale make it infeasible to do live talks. If you spend 3 minutes doing 'can you hear me' on a 10 minute slot, it sort of makes it a mess.

elements.text: The thing is, we have about 120 talks, and the amount of technical difficulties with video conferencing software you expect at that scale make it infeasible to do live talks. If you spend 3 minutes doing 'can you hear me' on a 10 minute slot, it sort of makes it a mess.

text: I wonder if there could be some way of arranging Q & A sessions to be held after each recorded talk is dropped.

text: It would not be a disaster if some technical problems occurred on that part, people could start entering a specific zoom room to chat about a session say 5 minutes before the end of the dropped video

text: I also am hoping that the state of the art in video conferencing software will have greatly improved by next summer !

elements.text: I also am hoping that the state of the art in video conferencing software will have greatly improved by next summer !

text: Maybe there should be a different discord channel for each talk, as there ended up being for each poster

elements.text: Maybe there should be a different discord channel for each talk, as there ended up being for each poster

text: I hope Gather.town gets improved a lot before the summer, that was a lot of fun
